Learning_Program_Content_Data.description: Indicates whether to recognize previous completions.
Indicates whether to recognize all previous completions.
Indicates whether to recognize previous completions as of a specific start date.
Indicates whether to recognize previous completions within a specific date range.
References the start date for recognizing previous completions.
References the end date for recognizing previous completions.
Specifies if Program Recognises Expiration Dates on Courses

validation.validation: If you set Recognize Previous Completions, you must set All Previous Completions, As-Of Date, or Within Date Range.
validation.description: If you set Recognize Previous Completions, you must set All Previous Completions, As-Of Date, or Within Date Range.

validation.validation: If you set Within Date Range, you must enter a Start Date and an End Date.
validation.description: If you set Within Date Range, you must enter a Start Date and an End Date.

validation.validation: Enter an End Date for previous completions that's on or before the current date.
validation.description: Enter an End Date for previous completions that's on or before the current date.

validation.validation: Enter a Start Date that's on or before the End Date.
validation.description: Enter a Start Date that's on or before the End Date.

validation.validation: If you set As-Of Date, you must enter a Start Date.
validation.description: If you set As-Of Date, you must enter a Start Date.

validation.validation: You must set Recognize Previous Completions, before you can set All Previous Completions, As-Of Date or Within Date Range.
validation.description: You must set Recognize Previous Completions, before you can set All Previous Completions, As-Of Date or Within Date Range.

validation.validation: Enter a Start Date for previous completions that's on or before the current date.
validation.description: Enter a Start Date for previous completions that's on or before the current date.

validation.validation: You can't set Recognize Previous Completions for stand-alone lesson content, but Workday automatically recognizes these completions.
validation.description: You can't set Recognize Previous Completions for stand-alone lesson content, but Workday automatically recognizes these completions.

validation.validation: If you set As-Of Date, you can't enter an End Date.
validation.description: If you set As-Of Date, you can't enter an End Date.

validation.validation: If you set All Previous Completions, you can't enter a Start Date or an End Date.
validation.description: If you set All Previous Completions, you can't enter a Start Date or an End Date.

validation.validation: You can't set Recognize Course Expiration Dates on external digital courses or stand-alone lessons in a program.
You need to set Requires Successful Completion on at least 1 item.
Content order values must be unique.
You can't associate inactive topics with a program. Enter 1 or more active topics.
Title must be unique.
Inactive sales items are not allowed
You can't add inactive content items to the program.
In Progress status cannot be added to Learning Programs.
Enter an Effective Date that's on or after today's date.
Security Categories can only be added to Programs if the Tenant Set Up flag for 'Enable Security Category' or 'Enable Topic and Security Category' is selected.
Reference IDs must be unique.
You can't add duplicate items to a program. Remove duplicate items before you submit.
Add 1 or more content items.
Competency values must be active.
Specify languages that are available on Workday
Enter an Expiration Date that is on or after the Effective Date of the program.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

validation.validation: Discard on Exit Validation Error

description: Container for the processing options for a business process. If no options are submitted (or the options are submitted as 'false') then the business process is simply initiated as if it where submitted on-line with approvals, reviews, notifications and to-do's in place. If the Initiator is an Integration System User, any validations you configured on the Initiation step are ignored.
